Contributing

Contrbuting to the Styleguide

Installing prequisite software

  • npm install -g harp@0.15.2
  • npm install -g bower

Note there is an issue with the current versions of harp & node. Installing harp v0.15.2 resolves the issue

Running the styleguide locally

npm run develop
This will install the bower dependencies and start the harp server. Harp's server watches any .scss, .less, .md, .ejs, .jade, etc. files and compiles them on the fly.

Editing the styleguide

Other than bootstrap & bootstrap's jquery dependency, the styleguide is framework/library agnostic. The small amount of .js in the guide is written in native javascript.

The styleguide is a static website built with harpjs. It uses .scss for .css and .ejs for html layouts and partials.

Working with Git

E*Trade Bootstrap lives in our internal gitlab instance. We use an adaptation of the Git Flow workflow to manage our branches in a sane way, and allow for code reviews, as well as having one place to manage conversations about components that is close to the code.

Naming convention for branches

Master Master is the main release branch and always reflects the production ready version of the project. Master is a protected branch that can only be modified by the project admins.

Development The development branch is a staging area for work that is intended for the next release. Development is a protected branch that can only be modified by the project admins.

Feature Branches Intended for new feature development. They use the naming convention feature/{name}.

Hotfix Branches Intended for critical bug fixes. They use the naming convention hotfix/{name}.

Submitting a Merge Request

When your work is complete, submit a Merge Request

Merge Request Do's:

  1. Update CHANGELOG.md with your updates. *. Delete the /dist directory before you submit your merge request. This makes it easier for project admins to do a code review.

Merge Request Don'ts:

  1. Bump the version number in package.json.
    *. Create a semver tag for your update.
